channel.title: What am I doing wrong?
channel.description:
I am using this tut : http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/snippets/418555-pi-adding-real-korasi-spec.html
and I get these errors...
[IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/20jmux1.png[/img]
Help for rep please!

item.title: What am I doing wrong?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:8, topic:460704”][quote author=manny458 link=topic=563638.msg4107069#msg4107069 date=1348104184]

Fixed it, but I can’t get the fucking spec to work…Added everything perfectly and no errors, yet the korasi still has no spec bar…

If This is Pi I can Help You Add Special To Korasi Threw Team Viewer
[/quote]

Wouldn’t accept help from one who cannot use the correct form of ‘through’, that’s just me personally though. I’d suggest checking out a Dragon Scimitar for example, and see the exact thing that shows the Special Bar. I’m trying to push you to learn Java yourself.[/quote]

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:4, topic:460704”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=563638.msg4107049#msg4107049 date=1348103360]
Add a closing bracket at the end of the class it looks like.
[/quote]
( and ) are parenthesis[/quote]
parentheses*
I wouldn’t accept help from one who does not know how to differentiate between singular and plural objects. That’s just me personally though.

What you have coded for Korasi and your CombatAssistant.java, then I can help you.

I didn’t know that was a declaration. I’m pretty sure he’s asking a question. I wouldn’t accept help from one who does not know the difference between a statement and a question. That’s just me personally though.

Anyways, stop spamming and leave the thread if you’re going to derail it. I’ve deleted all the insignificant posts, I’m pretty sure you know which.

Read full topic

item.title: What am I doing wrong?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Read full topic

item.title: What am I doing wrong?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:10, topic:460704”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=563638.msg4107080#msg4107080 date=1348104704]

Add a closing bracket at the end of the class it looks like.

} and { or [ and ] are considered brackets.
( and ) are parenthesis, and he has a balanced script/equation, so he shouldn’t be having problems in that sense.

However, (int file) should be replaced with (int CLASSNAME). Pretty sure.

No, the declaration of a primitive type can be named whatever you wish.

Also,

{ - Opening Curly Brace
} - Closing Curly Brace

[ - Opening Bracket
] - Closing Bracket

( - Opening Parenthesis
) - Closing Parenthesis
[/quote]

It can be deceiving when people consider parenthesis brackets. They need to use the correct terminology.[/quote]

He wasn’t referencing a brace as a parenthesis, he was saying bracket instead of brace. Anyways, @OP; your method is declared inside of another method, or outside of your class.

Read full topic

I choose to write the way i want to to write it faster sorry if you don’t like my writing ok now back to your server problem

Ok can you show me you ItemAssistant.java what you have coded for korasi and your CombatAssistant.java then i can help you

item.title: What am I doing wrong?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:9, topic:460704”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=563638.msg4107052#msg4107052 date=1348103508]

Add a closing bracket at the end of the class it looks like.

} and { or [ and ] are considered brackets.
( and ) are parenthesis, and he has a balanced script/equation, so he shouldn’t be having problems in that sense.

However, (int file) should be replaced with (int CLASSNAME). Pretty sure.
[/quote]

No, the declaration of a primitive type can be named whatever you wish.

Also,

{ - Opening Curly Brace
} - Closing Curly Brace

[ - Opening Bracket
] - Closing Bracket

( - Opening Parenthesis
) - Closing Parenthesis[/quote]

It can be deceiving when people consider parenthesis brackets. They need to use the correct terminology.

( and ) are parenthesis, and he has a balanced script/equation, so he shouldn’t be having problems in that sense.

However, (int file) should be replaced with (int CLASSNAME). Pretty sure.[/quote]

[ - Opening Bracket

( - Opening Parenthesis
